alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WARREN COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 328 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Edinboro to Franklin. Movement was east at 55 mph. Another cluster of storms is also moving north into Warren County. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Scandia, Lottsville, Grand Valley, Warren South, Garland, Kinzua Dam, Chapman State Park, Tidioute, Sugar Grove, Starbrick, Clarendon and Bear Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for north central Pennsylvania.
